comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content: query.nytimes.com CHILD'S MARRIAGE ANNULLED; Precedent for New York Established in the Cunningham Case. March 22, 1913, Saturday After three years of litigation Mrs. Anna Prell Cunningham, daughter of a Cedar Street restaurateur, obtained yesterday an annulment of her marriage to William Cunningham, to whom she was married in New Jersey on Jan. 30, 1910, when she was only 17 years of age. The application for an annulment was denied in November, 1910, by Supreme Court Justice Greenbaum, and his decision was upheld in June, 1911, by the Appellate Division. [ END OF FIRST PARAGRAPH ]
